intro: Sphaerorrhiza serrata, commonly known as the serrated globe lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, globe-shaped inflorescence. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy, white to pale yellow flowers with intricate patterns. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Sphaerorrhiza serrata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
